abstract: While it may help calm the credit markets, the backup fund agreed to on Friday by the nation’s biggest banks will not save troubled structured investment vehicles that hold billions of dollars in packaged loans.
snippet: While it may help calm the credit markets, the backup fund agreed to on Friday by the nation’s biggest banks will not save troubled structured investment vehicles that hold billions of dollars in packaged loans.
lead_paragraph: When the country’s three largest banks reached agreement on Friday on how to structure a $75 billion fund to prop up distressed securities, an exhausted group of its top planners gathered in a Bank of America conference room to toast their success with 12-packs of Bud Light.

headline.main: Some Wonder if the Banks’ Stabilization Fund Will Work
headline.print_headline: Some Wonder if the Banks’ Stabilization Fund Will Work
